meanings.definition: A person who shares equally in an inheritance with one or more others.
meanings.sent1: In the will, the siblings were named as coparceners of the family property.
meanings.sent2: The coparceners inherited the land jointly after their parents passed away.
meanings.sent3: The coparceners joked about splitting the inheritance equally and building a giant treehouse together.
meanings.sent4: The coparceners stood side by side, each holding a piece of the inherited map, planning their future together.
meanings.sent5: The concept of coparceners was explained to the children using a story about sharing toys equally.

meanings.definition: Those who inherit an estate together as joint tenants.
meanings.sent1: The coparceners decided to sell the property they inherited and split the profits.
meanings.sent2: As coparceners, they had equal rights to the estate left by their grandparents.
meanings.sent3: The coparceners playfully argued over who would get the bigger room in the inherited house.
meanings.sent4: The coparceners were like puzzle pieces, fitting perfectly together to manage the shared estate.
meanings.sent5: The bond between coparceners was unbreakable, forged through the shared responsibility of the inherited land.
